channel.title: Who likes telemarketers?!
channel.description:
http://www.robertgallen.com/ has been calling me since 9am to 9pm. These motherfuckers haven't left me alone since last week and are bothering me while i'm talking to others. I found out yesterday that they got my info from some stupid runescape toolbar or whatever that my retarded bothers put on my desktop computer. Not so bad they're just telemarketers rights? well i come to find my phone number is now spread out through the telemarketer community and i've been getting random calls from everywhere ever since.
I've been going through the process of getting a new phone number, but then i've been noticing that there are more and more trojans and Key-loggers getting into my registry somehow, and of course i find a root-kit ect... All because of that fucking runescape add on.
anyone else have an annoying experience with telemarketers?

item.title: Who likes telemarketers?!
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:4, topic:370222”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=466339.msg3410424#msg3410424 date=1290639648]

What the hell are telemarketers? Never heard of them, I’m from UK.

they should have em in the uk too.
wiki it, cause it’s such a trustworthy site

en.wikipedia.org

Telemarketing

Telemarketing (sometimes known as inside sales, or telesales in the UK and Ireland) is a method of direct marketing in which a salesperson solicits prospective customers to buy products or services, either over the phone or through a subsequent face to face or Web conferencing appointment scheduled during the call. Telemarketing can also include recorded sales pitches programmed to be played over the phone via automatic dialing. Telemarketing is defined as contacting, qualifying, and canvassing p...


[/quote]

Oh, never heard anyone from UK have any problems with that, or even mention it. That’d be pretty crap if they are ringing you. Can’t you request they stop?[/quote]

You do get it in the UK however you can opt-out by contacting BT.

Read full topic

Why couldn’t your antivirus pick it up and delete it successfully.

item.title: Who likes telemarketers?!
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

blakeman8192:

I love telemarketers, because they’re so fun to mess with.

I told one I was wanted for credit card fraud… he still wanted to know if I wanted to buy insurance :\

Read full topic
